security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond reading configuration files. It only provides instructions for AI assistants to help with git commits.

content.user_title: Enforce atomic backend commits with pre-commit quality gates
content.value_statement: Backend teams struggle with inconsistent code quality and non-atomic commits that mix unrelated changes. This skill enforces strict pre-commit checks and ensures every commit represents one logical change.
actual_capabilities: Runs ruff linting and formatting on modified Python files
Executes type checking with ty on changed files only
Enforces Django system checks and security scripts
Generates human-like commit messages without AI signatures
Removes local imports and debug statements
limitations: Cannot run tests without proper environment setup
Limited to Python backend projects with specific tooling

use_cases.title: Enforce atomic commits

use_cases.title: Standardize commit workflow
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent commit quality across the team with automated checks and formatting.

best_practices: Always run pre-commit mode before atomic-commit to fix issues early
Ensure .security/ scripts are up to date and executable
Review proposed commit messages for accuracy before committing
anti_patterns: Do not bypass the skill and commit manually with failing checks
Never ignore [BLOCKING] issues - they will fail CI
Do not use for non-Django projects without adjusting expectations

faq.question: Is this compatible with my non-Django Python project?
faq.answer: The skill works best with Django/Optimo repos but can run generic Python checks. Expect reduced functionality without Django-specific tooling.

faq.question: What if I don't have .security/ scripts?
faq.answer: The skill will skip missing scripts and note them as [SHOULD_FIX]. Consider adding the recommended security scripts for full coverage.

faq.question: Can I customize the commit message format?
faq.answer: The skill follows your AGENTS.md conventions. Modify your local AGENTS.md to change commit message formats.

faq.question: How does it handle test failures?
faq.answer: Test failures are marked as [BLOCKING] for atomic-commit mode. The skill will not approve commits with failing tests.

faq.question: Will it modify my code automatically?
faq.answer: Yes, in pre-commit mode it actively fixes formatting, imports, and obvious issues. In atomic-commit mode it may fix issues but prioritizes safety.

faq.question: Can I use this with OpenAI Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, install via skill-installer and use $skill backend-atomic-commit. The skill works with both Claude Code and Codex.
